To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: First recording is part 2 of various performances by Uncle Dave Macon (performer) and other unidentified performers, recorded in May of 1950 in Kittrell, Tennessee by Charles F. Bryan [according to tape case]. Second recording is a ""Let's Think"" forum held at Vanderbilt University in February of 1952, featuring Will R. Manier Jr. (moderator), Charles F. Bryan (panelist), Guy Taylor (panelist), Bill McDaniel (panelist), Beasley Smith (panelist), Eddy Arnold (panelist), and Hugh Cherry (panelist) on radio station WMAK (Nashville, Tenn.) Forum topics included opinions on the best and most interesting type of music, an extensive breakdown of folk music, and the future of country music.

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
recordInfo.recordOrigin: Record has been transformed into MODS v3.5 from a Qualified Dublin Core record by the Digital Library of Tennessee, a service hub of the Digital Public Library of America.
